title: Oliver Cromwell's letters and speeches: with elucidations.
author: Cromwell, Oliver
snippet: I rest, Your servant, Oliver Cromwell. f The base of Oliver's ' Dunbar Peninsula,' as we have called it (or Dunbar Pinfold where he is now hemmed in, upon ' an entan glement very difficult'), extends from Belhaven Bay on his right, to Brocksmouth House on his left ; ' about a mile and a half from sea to sea.' Brocksmouth House, the Earl (now Duke) of Rox burgh's mansion, which still stands there, his soldiers now occupy as their extreme post on the left.
